intro: Hymenoclea fasciculata var. patula, commonly known as the slender hymenoclea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
